transcripts.text: Tell them that Ireland is more than just an economy.  It is the home of the Irish people.

The only recovery that Fine Gael has brought in this country is recovery for the banks that broke this country.  I've seen the corruption in government in this country.  And it's not just in government, it's the parties in opposition as well.  Economics has to be secondary to who we are as a people, as a nation.  And if we don't cherish it and preserve it, it'll be an unbelievable tragedy.

Tell them that we won't allow our children to be raised for export.  Our healthcare system and our education system, two of the most relevant indicators of the developmental stage of a country, are in an absolute shambles.  We are sending our extremely educated and our extremely highly skilled nurses and doctors abroad.  They're being trained here and then they're leaving.  They're emigrating because there's nothing for them here in Ireland.  Ireland is not somewhere that they want to be.  The nurses' working conditions are atrocious.  Tell them that we won't stand idly by and become strangers in our own country.

We can't lose our identity.  We can't lose our character.  They want to cut you off at the roots for that.  They don't want you to have any roots or to think that, like, I mean, that you've got any attachment to your own country.  That's what that whole thing about, like, I mean, what's Irish?  We all know what Irish is.
Tell them that the right to life of the unborn is absolute and should never have been taken away.

To think that you desecrate a little child in the womb, a little baby in the womb... Hack it to death.  That's basically what they're doing.  And I'll just go as far as saying it's men and women that's been murdered in this country.
Tell them that we don't need more asylum centres or co-living apartments or properties for vulture funds.  We need Irish homes for Irish families.

How many Irish people will die homeless on the streets before change arrives?  I'm a stay-at-home mother with four children and I volunteer with the homeless.  I'm heavily involved in community activism.  I'm deeply committed to mental health issues.  I'd say in first hand how our community and other communities have been ripped apart from suicide and ordinary people like ourselves being forgotten about by our government.  There's an old saying, get your own backyard in order before you go trying to save the world.  And our country is in chaos with hospitalists, housing crisis, schools, everything, elderly, home care, all this.  We've got our own people to provide for.  We can't cope as a small country.  We're not a superpower.  We're not a world power.  We should look after our own people first, Joe.  Very wealthy developers in the area claim to have bought our private property.  This cottage here, which is about 300 years old, is supposed to be demolished.  We have been persecuted by the state.  for several years.
Tell them that ordinary workers and the rural economy must not be sacrificed at the altar of the carbon tax agenda.

It's time that Irish people and the people of this constituency in Longford and Westmead said no to carbon taxes.  Also the issue of USC, this universal social charge, which was introduced as an austerity tax to help pay for the bank bailout.  That tax for the banks must be abolished.
Tell them that the Irish nation won't wait around for governments to unite us.  We are united.
This is our land, the whole island of Ireland.
Tell them that neither Brussels nor London govern in the hearts of Irish men and women.

It's been a remarkable experience to knock on people's doors and discuss these things with them.  Just me and them, just talking, and they are in total agreement with what we're trying to put out there, our policies.  People are always open to it.  Just know that a political party would be willing to talk about the issues that we're talking about.  And there's nothing wrong with what we're talking about.  We're talking about Ireland.  And we're talking about the best possible future for our children.
Tell them that we won't be harassed or silenced for the crime of loving our country.  Tell them that Pádraig Piers was right when he said that Ireland belongs to the Irish.

The very fact that you have to ask that question, there's something very, very wrong there.  Like, what is Irish?  You have to ask that question of it.  I think the real question should be, when is Ireland not Irish anymore?
Send them a message.  Vote for Am Pádraig na Sionta, the National Party.
